title.narrative: 004 NUTRITION MULTISECTORAL POLICY SUPPORT

description.narrative: By 2025, Ethiopia's National and Regional government mechanisms and systems have the capacity to implement the multi-sectoral policy with an accountability framework, and enhanced coordination including for humanitarian and development nexus, which contributes to Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition In Early Childhood (Covid), Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, chronic malnutrition (stunting) and wasting in children is reduced including in humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, Ethiopia?s National and Regional government mechanisms and systems have the capacity to implement the multi-sectoralpolicy with an accountability framework, and enhanced coordination including for humanitarian and development nexus

description.narrative: Beside the endorsement of the Food and Nutrition Strategy, UNICEF supported the Government on its costing over the year. The estimate for ten-year implementation approximated US$2.5 billion. A focus has been given to emergency in the Strategy, US$290 million is estimated to be invested in ten years to build the nutrition resilience of vulnerable people. As a result, the National Disaster Risk Management Commission planned to include most of the newly approved activities, including strengthening the early warning system for nutrition information from the community level up to the national level and generating an evidence-based emergency preparedness and response plan. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:07/01/2022
